setting.location: Boothbay Harbor, Maine (coastal fishing village near Portland)
setting.historical_context: Post-WWI trauma, Prohibition corruption, period-appropriate social attitudes
setting.atmosphere: Creeping dread through ecological corruption; no overt supernatural spectacle

protagonist.weakness: Alcohol dependence (flask mechanic); tremors when sober
protagonist.assets: Press credentials, .38 revolver, tide almanac, observational skills

antagonists.primary_threat: Cult of Dagon (infiltrated townsfolk and hybrids)
hybrid_characteristics: Gill-slits on neck (become visible during stress)

transformation_mechanics.vector: Violet bioluminescent kelp filaments entering through skin/water ingestion
stages: Stage 1: Peripheral unease around water sources (Turns 1-5)
Stage 2: Visual distortions (shadows move wrong, geometric vertigo) (Turns 6-10)
transformation_mechanics.containment: Freshwater exposure slows but doesn't reverse transformation; complete immersion causes cellular unraveling

key_npcs.name: Chief Burroughs
key_npcs.secret: Hybrid in late Stage 3; vertical pupils visible in daylight

key_npcs.name: Mayor Gilman
key_npcs.secret: Inherited Deep One bloodline; coordinates transformations
key_npcs.motivation: Prepare town for 'the Change' to join Y'ha-nthlei

key_npcs.name: Mrs. Croft
key_npcs.secret: Hybrid in Stage 4; gill-slits permanently open

key_npcs.name: Eleanor
key_npcs.secret: Brother transformed last month; resists through freshwater discipline
key_npcs.motivation: Protect remaining uncorrupted townsfolk; warn outsiders

key_npcs.name: Elias Marsh
key_npcs.secret: Fighting infection through physical restraints and isolation
key_npcs.motivation: Document truth before succumbing; leave evidence for others

locations.name: Harbor Docks
locations.features: Fishing boats, census badge near Devil's Throat cave entrance
locations.dangers: Hybrid fishermen observing newcomers; contaminated tide pools

locations.name: Harbor Diner
locations.features: Eleanor works here; gossip hub during lunch rush
locations.dangers: Cook is Stage 3 hybrid; food/water potentially contaminated

locations.name: Sailor's Rest Boarding House
locations.features: Room 5 (protagonist's room); census taker's abandoned suitcase
locations.dangers: Mrs. Croft searches rooms nightly; basement contains ritual space

locations.name: Devil's Throat Sea Caves
locations.features: Accessible only at true low tide (2:14 AM per Portland almanac)
locations.dangers: Cult ritual site; bone mosaics; pool showing Y'ha-nthlei reflections

locations.name: Creek Inlet South
locations.features: Violet kelp blooms; landward-moving crabs; Elias's shack
locations.dangers: Waterborne filaments; frog vortexes inducing compulsive behavior

locations.name: Dagon's Bowl Stone Circle
locations.features: Ancient standing stones with spiral carvings; rainwater basin
locations.dangers: Shows compulsive visions; amplifies water-based infection

locations.name: Lighthouse (Western Point)
locations.features: Shortwave radio; freshwater well protected by copper piping
locations.dangers: Three creek crossings en route; cult patrols after midnight

water_vectors: Groundwater contamination (wells, springs beyond Maiden's Tear)
Violet kelp filaments (attach to skin/clothing, pulse with infection rhythm)
Amphibian vectors (frogs with galaxy-specked eyes create compulsive vortexes)
terrestrial_signs: Pine trees growing in non-Euclidean spirals
Fungi pulsing with violet light matching victim's heartbeat
Absence of normal wildlife (no owls, rodents, insects near corruption zones)
containment_zones: Maiden's Tear spring (clean until October 13 evening)
Freshwater streams flowing west (away from harbor)

narrative_arc.turn_1_5: Discovery phase: ecological anomalies, census badge, Elias's journal
narrative_arc.turn_6_10: Containment phase: water contamination awareness, Eleanor alliance, cult surveillance
narrative_arc.turn_11_15: Crisis phase: Tommy's transformation, cottage siege, wilderness flight
narrative_arc.turn_16_20: Resolution phase: stone circle confrontation, irreversible choices, epilogue

optimal_path: Turn 6: Secure clean water sources immediately after Elias encounter
Turn 9: Take truck to lighthouse (avoid water tower observation)
Turn 15: Cross creeks using journal pages as water filters
Turn 18: Transmit partial warning via lighthouse radio before capture
Turn 20: Physical survival with evidence recovered by Coast Guard

critical_errors: Entering Devil's Throat before securing clean water supply
Fleeing into wilderness instead of toward human infrastructure
Destroying evidence during moments of despair
